author: Staff Reporter
text:
Water tank operators, conservancy workers and drivers who were employed with eight village panchayats and two municipalities that got merged with Tirupur Corporation, gave a representation to Collector S. Jayandhi highlighting disparity in wages. A total of 223 workers who were merged with the corporation staff core more than three years ago, were yet getting only consolidated monthly wages. “The 184 overhead water tank operators, 34 conservancy workers and five drivers, totalling 223 workers, are given monthly wages in the range of Rs. 2,000 to Rs. 4,000”, they pointed out. They expressed displeasure that when the issue was raised at regular intervals but did not get solution. In another petition, women conservancy workers from Periyakottai village panchayat sought increase in wages. “We are presently getting Rs. 3,200 a month despite having a service of 15 years”, said P. Malligai, one of the workers.

title: Workers express concern over wage disparity
